Procedure for RNAse Treatment and ethanol precipitation of DNA

Materials and methods

  1. First Qubit the DNA samples
  2. Add 10x NEB buffer the DNA at a final conc of 1x
  3. Add 1uL of RNase and incubate at 37 degrees for 20min2
  4. Heat inactivate RNase at 70 degrees for 20minutes

Procedure for Ethanol precipitation

  1. Add 1/10 volume of 3M sodium acetate
  2. Add 3.0 X volume (calculated after addition of sodium acetate) of at least 100% ethanol.
  3. Incubate on ice for 15 minutes.
  4. Centrifuge at > 14,000 x g for 15 minutes at room temperature or 4 Â°C
  5. Discard supernatant being careful not to throw out DNA pellet which may or may not be visible
  6. Rinse with 70% Ethanol, spin and discard supernatant
  7. Centrifuge again for 15 minutes.
  8. Discard supernatant and dry tube inverted (on Kimwipe) on bench at room temp until dry
  9. Resuspend in liquid of choice (TE or water)
  10. Qubit again.
Written by Daniel V Brown 21 May 2013
